Restored full text of the inscription:
1.[Shahr Yagill bin Yadaʿʾab,] King of Qatabān, has promulgated and decreed from Ḥaṭabum, the tem- 2.[ple of ʿAmm Dhū-Dawānim and from Ra]ṣafum, the temple of ʾAnbay-the patron-god-and on behalf of Shamas 3.[and the protector of Shahr for his vassals Maʿdīka]rib of the lineage of Haybar and Waddʾīl of the lineage of Rābiḥ and their kinsmen, 4.[the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and] their wives, without any shortcomings or cessation or detraction or 5.[termination, for the patronage-tie of friendship and affiliation] and protection, for (the sake of) ʿAmm and ʾAthīrat. Let, then, 6.[the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and] their [wives] hold themselves bound to this commandment. And Shahr has decreed for his vassals, 7.[the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and] their [wives] with their concurrence, in accordance with this commandment and (these) records. 8.[And Shahr has directed his vassals, the priests of Labakh, to inscribe and engrave these records in the valley] 9.[of Labakh and in their designated place in the temple of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh in Dhū-Ghaylim. The month of Bashimum, the] 10.[first year of ʿAmmīʿalī Dhū-Gharībum. Now these individuals, the priests of Labakh who are in possess-] 11.[ion of property, in particular that which (is designated) in the document of Datīnat, and the products and the crops of ʿAmm. And it was signed by the hand of Shahr.] 12.[And Nabaṭʿamm bin ʾĪlīsamaʿ of the lineage of Haybar has directed and completed the inscriptions of this place,] 13.[under the pro-] 14.[tection of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and his priests.]
